q: of one sun god, Aton. The bust is at the top of a "wish list" of five major artifacts exhibited abroad that Egypt wants returned as part of its cultural heritage. Egypt recognises and appreciates the care and effort undertaken by the government of Germany to preserve and display the painted limestone bust of Queen Nefertiti, Zahi Hawass said in a statement. But he asked that "this unique treasure be returned to the possession of its rightful owners, the Egyptian people." Play video Moscow Airport Blast Kills At Least

contemplated leaving, even after Dick Cheney told him that he had to stay. In May 2004, when Bush visited the Pentagon and then repaired to Donald Rumsfeld 's office, the secretary handed him yet another I-quit letter. I have concluded that the damage from the acts of abuse that happened on my watch, by individuals for whose conduct I am ultimately responsible, can best be responded to by my resignation, it said. Bush rejected the idea. Donald Rumsfeld said his mind was made up. But Bush would not accept the resignation, and Donald Rumsfeld says he eventually accepted the decision. To no one

down with David Letterman to talk about the Super Bowl, Green Bay and of course Brett Favre came up in conversation. When asked whether Brett Favre 's wishy-washy decision to retire had any affect on him: I was the guy that took all the reps in the off season, and he was the guy who took all the reps during the season. So, that's kind-of how it worked out, said Aaron Rodgers . Aaron Rodgers topped off his David Letterman appearance with a good ol' pigskin toss to David Letterman . there." Shayne Ward also addressed a report which claimed that he would be dropped by Simon Cowell 's record label SyCo this year. "All's absolutely fine," he said. Obviously I had a three-album deal so it's up for negotiation now. Really those rumours are just lazy journalism. It was a three-album deal and we'll negotiate getting the next deal. We know the police were not keen on that subject because when I called for a very clear review of this, the police scurried back into Scotland Yard, spent less than a day reviewing it and popped out again in time for the Six O'Clock news to say that they had discovered no further evidence. In the Apple case, he stayed longer on the board than he should have, given the interest his company was pursuing." Once you are on the black list at Apple, Roger Kay added, you don't get to come back. That also leaves out the not-too-small question of how Google Inc. would react to having its former leader run a key competitor. Lawsuits would be more than likely- if Eric Schmidt is not already tied down by a

18 months." There has also been talk of tension between Eric Schmidt and Page on competing priorities, Seth Harris added, with Eric Schmidt emphasizing the need to protect margins and Page pushing for more innovation. Google has to do both but is losing talent and facing tough competition, so the balance is tough to reach, he concluded. All of this is true, but replacing Eric Schmidt with Page is not necessarily the answer, said Seth Harris Dalka, a digital strategy consultant and keynote speaker.

the Statesman's Laylan Copelin: "State Reps. Tom Craddick and Eddie Rodriguez are a political odd couple united by their legislation that payday lenders say will put them out of business." From the Statesman's Mike Pence Ward: Texans 70 and older would not have to show a photo ID to vote. People without a driver's license could get a free state photo ID card to vote. And people could use their concealed-handgun licenses to vote. Those are among the provisions of a voter ID bill the Gov. Rick Perry Senate approved late Wednesday and sent to the House, where approval also is expected. But both supporters and opponents predicted Thursday that the proposal will be changed some more before it gains final approval.
